title: Modern Sans Serif
content:
I was sent a raster image embedded in a docx file. I'm supposed to use this logo for signage. When will the world understand?

Please help me ID this sans serif.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317051342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NTE%20BW_5031.jpg)

Font: 

 Ferrovial 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317051342/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: AcousticWonder

comments.content:
Thanks.

How did you....

Well it appears that I NEED the vector, or my client will have to live with a tracing. Can't nobody get no custom font downloaded!

Amazing Ryuk! Do you just happen to know these, or what? I am impressed with how many of these fonts you find so quickly.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks Mike :) I didn't remember this one at first sight, firstly thought it could be a bespoke and by Fontsmith (mainly because of the single storey /a, earmark of Fontsmith) but I was wrong. Then I checked [North Tarrant Express](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317051342/http:/www.northtarrantexpress.com/) website hoping for a webfont or a good PDF. No luck. And finally thought somebody would have previously asked for it, checked [MyFonts WhatTheFont Forum](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317051342/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/case/395825) and found the answer (thanks of Akira1975 as usual I would say).

Well, then thanks to both you and Akira1975. Hopefully my client can scrounge up the source vector file. If not, I may have to contact Ferrovial, the parent company of the contractor I'm working with.
